item.title: General Atlantic 以 1.27 亿美元的交易退出印度 PNB 住房公司
item.description: 证券交易所数据显示，美国私募股权公司 General Atlantic 周三出售了其在印度 PNB 住房金融公司价值 106.9 亿卢比（1.274 亿美元）的全部股份。【原文：U.S. private equity firm General Atlantic on Wednesday sold its entire stake worth 10.69 billion rupees ($127.40 million) in India's PNB Housing Finance , stock exchange data showed.】

item.title: 巴菲特 "看跌 "石油公司西方石油，能否阻止股价下跌？
item.description: 周二，美国石油生产商西方石油公司（Occidental Petroleum）的股价跌至 56.17 美元，跌破了其最大持有者、亿万富翁投资者沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）经常买入的水平。【原文：Shares in U.S. oil producer Occidental Petroleum fell to $56.17 on Tuesday, below a level that has routinely triggered purchases by its biggest holder, billionaire investor Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway .】

item.title: 摩根士丹利下调墨西哥股票评级至 "减持"，并下调中国目标股价
item.description: 投资银行摩根士丹利周三对墨西哥股票发出 "减持 "警告，原因是担心墨西哥计划对司法和选举制度进行改革，同时还下调了对中国主要市场的预测。【原文：Investment bank Morgan Stanley issued an "underweight" warning on Mexican shares on Wednesday due to concerns about planned changes to the judiciary and electoral system, and also downgraded forecasts for China's main markets.】

item.title: 市场下滑，美容零售商丝芙兰裁减中国职位
item.description: 路威酩轩集团（LVMH）旗下美妆零售商丝芙兰（Sephora）周三表示，该公司将削减其在中国的员工人数，因为中国是世界第二大经济体，消费者将减少在面霜和化妆品上的消费。【原文：LVMH-owned beauty retailer Sephora is cutting its workforce in China, the company said on Wednesday, as consumers curb their spending on creams and make-up in the world's No. 2 economy.】

item.title: 贝莱德在股东大会季减少对一些 ESG 决议的支持
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）的全球投票记录报告显示，在最近的年度股东大会上，贝莱德减少了对与环境和社会问题相关的股东提案的支持，支持率仅为 4%。【原文：BlackRock, the world's biggest asset manager, cut its support for shareholder proposals linked to environmental and social issues in the most recent annual general meeting season, backing just 4%, a report on its global voting record showed.】

item.title: 随着需求复苏，芯片制造商模拟器件公司预测第四季度业绩强劲
item.description: 美国模拟器件公司（Analog Devices）周三预测第四季度收入和利润将高于华尔街预期，因为该公司受益于消费电子产品芯片需求的恢复。【原文：Analog Devices forecast fourth-quarter revenue and profit above Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, as it benefits from returning demand for its chips used in consumer electronics.】

item.title: 全球股市将小幅上涨，取决于一系列降息措施：路透调查
item.description: 路透社对股票策略师进行的一项调查显示，在主要央行将进行一系列降息的预期升温之际，未来几个月全球股市将摆脱近期的市场动荡，在当前水平上小幅上涨。【原文：Global stocks will brush aside recent market turmoil and gain modestly from current levels in coming months, according to a Reuters poll of equity strategists, amid rising expectations major central banks are set for a series of interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 福特改变电动车计划，推迟推出电动卡车，砍掉三排座 SUV
item.description: 福特汽车公司正在调整其电动汽车计划，取消三排座 SUV 并推迟下一代皮卡的生产，同时在未来的产品阵容中增加新的皮卡和面包车，以适应电动汽车增长速度低于预期的情况。【原文：Ford Motor is reshuffling its electric vehicle plans, killing its three-row SUV and delaying its next-generation pickup while adding a new pickup and van to its future lineup as it adjusts to slower-than-expected EV growth.】

item.title: 中国滴滴出行第二季度扭亏为盈
item.description: 中国最大的打车公司滴滴出行第二季度净利润从去年同期的 3 亿元人民币亏损转为 14 亿元人民币（1.9624 亿美元），该公司正继续恢复受监管打击严重的业务。【原文：China's largest ride-hailing company, Didi Global , swung to a net profit of 1.4 billion yuan ($196.24 million) for the second quarter from a 300 million yuan loss a year earlier as it continues to build back its business badly hit by a regulatory crackdown.】

item.title: TJ Maxx 母公司第二季度业绩超预期，因需求强劲上调全年利润预期
item.description: 非价格零售商 TJX Cos 周三上调了年度利润预期，此前该公司的季度业绩超过预期，主要得益于成本下降以及对低价服装和配饰的稳定需求。【原文：Off-price retailer TJX Cos raised annual profit forecast after beating quarterly results on Wednesday, banking on gains from easing costs and steady demand for its low-price apparel and accessories.】

item.title: 航空公司暂停以色列航班
item.description: 在 10 月 7 日开始的以色列-哈马斯战争一开始，国际航空公司就暂停了往返特拉维夫的数百个航班以及飞往黎巴嫩和约旦的一些航班。【原文：International airlines suspended hundreds of flights to and from Tel Aviv, as well as some to Lebanon and Jordan, at the outset of the Israel-Hamas war that began on Oct. 7.】

item.title: H&M 将关闭数码分店 Afound
item.description: 瑞典 H&M 集团周三发表声明称，由于需求疲软，该集团将于今年晚些时候关闭数字时尚商店 Afound。【原文：H&M will close down digital fashion outlet Afound later this year due to weak demand, the Swedish group said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 梅西百货因高价商品需求疲软而调低年度收入预期
item.description: 梅西百货公司（Macy's）周三下调了年度净销售额预期，原因是通胀疲软的顾客减少了对高档服装和配饰的消费，导致该百货公司股价盘前下跌 10%。【原文：Macy's lowered its annual net sales forecast on Wednesday as inflation-weary customers hold back from spending on upscale apparel and accessories, sending shares of the department store operator down 10% premarket.】

item.title: Tether 将提供与阿联酋迪拉姆挂钩的稳定币
item.description: 全球最大的稳定币 Tether 周三表示，它计划提供一种与阿拉伯联合酋长国（阿联酋）迪拉姆挂钩的新稳定币，以满足对海湾地区货币的需求，并寻求提供美元的替代品。【原文：The world's largest stablecoin, Tether, said on Wednesday it plans to provide a new stablecoin pegged to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) dirham as it taps demand for the Gulf currency and seeks to offer alternatives to the U.S. dollar.】

item.title: 降价促进季度销售，塔吉特上调年度利润预期
item.description: 塔吉特周三上调了年度利润预期，第二季度可比销售额超出华尔街预期，原因是越来越多的美国人被低价杂货和生活必需品吸引到其门店购物。【原文：Target raised its annual profit forecast on Wednesday and beat Wall Street expectations for second-quarter comparable sales as more Americans shopped at its stores drawn by low priced groceries and essentials.】

item.title: Peloton 财报将关注首席执行官人选和增加用户的努力
item.description: Peloton Interactive 的投资者将在这家健身器材制造商周四发布的业绩报告中，了解其首席执行官任命的最新情况，以及该公司在 2025 财年为增加用户数量所做的努力。【原文：Peloton Interactive's investors will look for updates on its CEO appointment and efforts to grow subscribers in fiscal 2025 when the fitness equipment maker reports results on Thursday.】

item.title: 印度部长指责亚马逊和电子商务公司掠夺性定价
item.description: 印度商务部长指责亚马逊和其他电子商务公司的掠夺性定价行为，并表示该行业的迅速崛起不应扰乱该国数百万家实体店的运营。【原文：India's commerce minister accused Amazon and other e-commerce companies of predatory pricing practices and said the sector's rapid rise should not disrupt millions of brick-and-mortar stores operating in the country.】

item.title: 英国监管机构放弃对苹果和谷歌应用商店的调查
item.description: 英国竞争监督机构周三表示，将放弃对苹果应用商店和谷歌游戏商店的调查，转而根据新的数字市场竞争制度调查竞争问题。【原文：UK's competition watchdog on Wednesday said it will discard its probes into Apple app store and Google playstore and will now look into competition concerns under the new digital markets competition regime.】

item.title: 美国石油出口增长放缓，产量和全球需求不温不火
item.description: 美国原油出口在经历了多年的强劲增长后，2024 年的增幅将趋于平稳，在全球石油需求持续低迷的情况下，预计国内产量的增幅将是大流行病以来最小的。【原文：U.S. crude oil export gains should plateau in 2024 after years of strong growth, with domestic output expected to increase by the smallest amount since the pandemic at a time when global oil demand remains sluggish.】

item.title: 加拿大银行信贷质量受关注，第三季度不良贷款准备金出现增长
item.description: 分析师预测，加拿大六大银行可能将在第三季度拨出总额为 45 亿加元的贷款损失准备金，比去年同期增长近 27%，原因是在经济形势严峻的情况下，破产率上升，贷款机构为信用卡和其他拖欠贷款做准备。【原文：Canada's big six banks will probably set aside a total of C$4.5 billion in loan loss provisions in the third quarter, analysts predicted, up nearly 27% from a year ago, as insolvencies rise and lenders prepare for credit card and other delinquencies in a challenging economy.】

item.title: 路透社如何计算特朗普组织的财务状况
item.description: 路透社试图估算前总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald J. Trump）的各种业务所产生的现金流，以了解该业务在过去十年中发生了怎样的变化，以及针对他的超过 5 亿美元的法庭判决可能会在多大程度上对该业务造成压力。【原文：Reuters sought to estimate the cashflow being generated by former President Donald J. Trump’s various businesses to try to understand how that business has changed over the past decade and the extent to which over $500 million in court judgments against him may put strains on that business.】

item.title: 美国 无情的反弹暂停喘息
item.description: 塞缪尔-因迪克对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by Samuel Indyk】

item.title: 大科技公司希望人工智能受到监管。他们为什么反对加州的人工智能法案？
item.description: 加利福尼亚州的立法者们最快将于本周就一项法案进行投票，该法案将对加州如何开发和部署人工智能进行广泛的监管，尽管一些科技巨头已经表示了广泛的反对意见。【原文：California legislators are set to vote on a bill as soon as this week that would broadly regulate how artificial intelligence is developed and deployed in California even as a number of tech giants have voiced broad opposition.】

item.title: 美联储会议纪要将显示有关 7 月降息的激烈争论
item.description: 虽然现在的焦点是 9 月份美联储开始降息，但至少一些美国央行行长在上个月的政策会议上热衷于就此展开讨论。【原文：While the focus is now on September for the start of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, at least some U.S. central bankers were keen to get the debate about it rolling at last month's policy meeting.】

item.title: 欧元从市场动荡中胜出
item.description: 欧元兑美元汇率创下今年以来的新高，成为近期全球货币市场动荡中的明显赢家，这使得强势美元动荡不安，并阻止了日本日元的持续下滑。【原文：The euro is trading at its highest this year against the dollar, emerging as a clear winner from the recent ructions in global currency markets that have unsettled a strong dollar and halted a relentless slide in Japan's yen.】

item.title: 得益于汽车业务和智能手机销售，小米第二季度收入大增 32
item.description: 中国小米公司周三公布第二季度营收增长 32%，主要得益于汽车业务部门带来的新收入来源，以及手机销售强劲的推动。【原文：China's Xiaomi Corp posted a 32% rise in second-quarter revenue on Wednesday, driven by new revenue streams from its auto business unit and boosted by strong sales of handsets.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，特斯拉将召回 9,000 多辆 Model X SUV
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，特斯拉正在召回 9,136 辆 Model X 运动型多功能车，原因是车顶上的一个饰件可能会分离，从而增加发生碰撞的风险。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said Tesla is recalling 9,136 Model X sports utility vehicles over a trim on the roof that could separate, increasing the risk of a crash.】

item.title: 中国机构称欧盟电动汽车关税草案缺乏客观性和公正性
item.description: 一家中国行业机构周三表示，欧盟对中国电动汽车（EV）的反补贴调查结论草案缺乏客观性和公正性。【原文：The European Union's draft findings from an anti-subsidy investigation into Chinese electric vehicles (EV) lack objectivity and fairness, a Chinese industry body said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储会议纪要和非农就业数据修正前的期货市场停滞不前
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货基本持平，因为在美国就业数据初步修正和美联储上次政策会议纪要公布之前，投资者仍持观望态度。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were largely flat on Wednesday, as investors remained on the sidelines ahead of the preliminary revisions to U.S. payrolls data and the release of minutes from the Federal Reserve's last policy meeting.】

item.title: 中国上汽集团誓言在欧盟起草补贴调查结果后采取进一步措施
item.description: 在欧盟委员会公布对中国电动汽车的反补贴调查结论草案后，中国上汽集团周三表示，将进一步采取法律措施保护自身权益。【原文：China's SAIC Motor said on Wednesday it will take further legal measures to protect its rights and interests following the European Commission's draft findings from its anti-subsidy investigations into Chinese electric vehicles.】
